result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:07 AM Defendant Richard NMI Rice in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Richard NMI Rice.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites the agreement, All parties agree.   As part of the agreement, Case is dismissed and read in.

Court calls case and recites appearances.  Warrant quashed.  Attny Chapman indicates to schedule for sentencing hearing.   Court sets. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Chapman indicates offer received, unsure of why DEF not present.  Court issues warrant with no restrictions. 09:19 AM Defendant Richard NMI Rice in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman appears by zoom.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by zoom for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Chapman to proceed with preliminary hearing.   State calls witness, Deputy Lucas Shepard, court sworn in witness.  State request court take  Judicial Notice of Bond in Case 21CF273,  Attny Chapman no objection, Court takes judicial notice.   State begins examination.  Attny Chapman stipuates to work experience.  State continues examination.   9:24 AM Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.   State tenders witness.  9:24 AM  Cross-Examination by Attny Chapman.   Attny Chapman no further questions. 9:25 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Chapman no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.     Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.     Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
